comment: I took Professor Hollingsworth online, so I don't know her, but if you take it online let me warn you: she didn't respond to emails until weeks later, took 1-2 months to grade assignments, her syllabus was someone else's and was not complete so we didn't know what projects were worth, and she didn't open up projects until the week of the due date.

FORGET ABOUT EVERY OTHER REVIEW PREVIOUS TO THIS ONE! I had Carol for a previous IS course I took hybrid, and I got an A. FORGET IT! An unbearable amount of work that she clearly didn't create. She forged other professors' announcements and due dates as her own. She had 2 projects that didn't work due to issues. Worst class ever

Spring '22. She is a lovely, caring woman who was quick to respond through emails. She always made it known she was happy to see our faces in class, cuz boy is the content boring and skippable. Workload is a bit much, but it is easy to get an A if you work on assignments while she's going through the powerpoint in class. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Prof is super caring and understanding. She allows a lot of wiggle room and was very "work at your own pace"--but beware, you will learn nothing in class-- you have to take notes from the PowerPoints online to actually prepare for tests/quizzes. Lots of quizzes, projects, one big group project. She tended to go off on tangents and waste class time.

I understand why people don't like her; TONS of assignments but if you get to know her shes nice. Attending class definitely isnt required but I went and I think she went easier on the grading for me because of it. She tells a lot of personal and just random stories. Overall if you take her class just keep up with the assignments and you will be ok

Worst at grading things. She lectures all of class about coffee. Your grades are projects that she hardly goes over in class. I had to ask for help from other people in the class that knew what they were doing. Big group project at the end. Gave extra credit for both the midterm and final & told us what was going to be on the final.

I took this online. We didn't know grades from assignments due in January until the last week, she may be a nice person, but she is a horrible professor. Who expects a group project from an online class and then expects you to find your own group? Ridiculous...
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Her assignments are easy but you have to go the extra mile for her lockdown browser tests. That ask the stupid questions not truly related to the workforce or jobs related to the class. Plus none of our assignments were graded until the last week. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Took the online class, professor is a nice person but did not grade a single assignment till the last week. Have weekly quizzes and two tests that are fair if you did all the mind tap extra stuff. Easy intro to ISA/Cybersecurity.

Some assignments - very clear on what she expects, gives you detailed instructions on how to complete the tasks required of you. Other ones - not clear with directions; you're left sort of working your way through an assignment, hoping that you don't stray too far from what she expects. Don't take this particular class if you're not an ISA major.

You have to earn your grade and sometimes she is not clear on some assignments, but since she is so nice and helpful she will clarify anything your confused about.  She also cares about the students and is willing to give advice.  As far as some of the comments saying she talks about herself, its good to hear about real experience in the field.

Most of the time was spent talking amongst students. Pointless to attend most of the time, since you will have to teach yourself anyways. Tests are ridiculously hard. Nice person, not so good professor. You will have to work for your grade, which may be a good thing. Easy team project, as long as you have good members.

Quiz every single class period. Way to many assignmentsprojects for what this class is worth and takes forever to grade them. Also takes far too many points off for silly errors. Useless class. Prof spends more time speaking about herself and the MANY jobs she's had than actually teaching anything useful. Group project is a pain. Stay away!
Easy A! Professor takes her time grading projects, but all in all an easy class to take online.

Where do I begin.. Great person!  She's funny!  Not a good professor.. If you're not a computer wiz you're screwed... quizzes every week, midterm, 4 projects slammed at you after midterm, group project, and a final.   If you aren't great at Excel or naked HTML you're screwed on the first two projects.. Don't take unless you're a computer geek....

This class is really nothing but a bunch of nonsense. This is how the class goes: weekly quizzes of "readings" and are very hard to pass, there is an excel, power point, word, and group project all due within 2 weeks towards the end of semester. In class: we talk about her personal life and how much of a failure she is. Do not take this professor

Extremely difficult, makes an intro class into a 3000 level class.  Better be good at Excel or your screwed.  Tests are hard gives quizzes a lot drops lowest quiz grade.  Worst complaint: She thinks all her students are IS majors who know how to fix a computer on their own
Not approachable or friendly
She is nice, she is very helpful. but she talks about her personal life more than she teaches. That sounds fun, but trust me its annoying.

This professor made an intro IS course more complicated than it needed to be. Grades consisted of two projects and two exams. Much of the exam material didn't match what had been covered in class. Project instructions were unclear and expectations absurdly unrealistic. She's a funny and nice lady, but her teaching and grading style are poor. Avoid.
Overall a nice lady, just not a very good instructor. Not very clear on what the overall direction of the class was and projects were muddled because there was no real hard guidelines.

I'm not sure why so many people complain about this professor. As long as you aren't a slack ass and you actually attend class and show her that you really are trying your very best, she is very willing to help you as best she can. She does not pity slackers and she is not gonna be willing to curve grades for those who show no effort.Great Prof!!

Don't bother buying to book. She rambles on in lectures and gives extremely hard projects compared to the other teachers. But she helps you out with them if you need help. Midterm is very hard. And final is pretty simple. Not an easy professor, but she expects the best from you, so you learn a lot. The Excel project will give you nightmares.

Very nice and provides an enjoyable class experience. When everyone bombed the first test she gave the class an extra credit assignment worth 20% of that test.  2nd and 3rd Tests were take-home.  The group projects required a bit of work but were spread out.  Beware if you take two of her classes, you'll have tests/projects due on the same day.

she's nice, but what a painful class.  2 projects, 2 exams, 1 group project.  you better be a master in excel functions or you're gonna hurt on the first project.  (others that talk about it here aren't exaggerating.) the paper and the group project are more realistic.  i'm not a fan of her exams, very difficult to know what to study.

Do not take her! Harsh grader you turn in project and she doesn't even let you see what you did wrong or even why you got points deducted. Oh and it takes her FOREVER to grade anything... The midterm was ridiculous impossible to study for... Nicest lady ever... but terrible techer, she doesnt even really teach, class is more like story time AVOID

She's an overall friendly professor but her expectations of you in the class are a bit extreme. I'm a dean's list/president's list kind of guy and I'm having a hard time. BEWARE OF HER EXAMS. Studied a week and a half in advance and made a 70 on the first one. Second one required about 15 pages of diagrams and an impossible multiple choice section.

DO NOT take this class with her. I've never had to drop a class before, until this one. This professor expects everyone to already have their associate's degree in IS. When I asked for help, she sent me ONE WORD answers. She won't allow help outside of class without writing you up for academic dishonesty. My BF is an IS major & he couldn't do it!!!
